name: testscript-example-search
title: TestScript Example Search
description: TestScript example resource with simple Patient search test. The read tests will utilize user defined dynamic variables that will hold the Patient search parameter values.

link.description: Demographics and other administrative information about an individual or animal receiving care or other health-related services.

variable.name: PatientSearchFamilyName
variable.description: Enter patient search criteria for a known family name on the target system

variable.name: PatientSearchGivenName
variable.description: Enter patient search criteria for a known given name on the target system

variable.name: PatientSearchBundleTotal
variable.description: Evaluate the returned Patient searchset Bundle.total value

operation.description: Test simple search to verify server support.
operation.label: TestSearch

assert.description: Confirm that the request url contains the family search parameter.
assert.label: 01-Parameter

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
assert.label: 02-Response200

assert.description: Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.
assert.label: 03-ResponseBundle

assert.description: Confirm that the returned Bundle correctly defines the navigation links.
assert.label: 04-ResponseNavigationLink

test.name: Patient Create Search
test.description: Create a Patient resource and capture the returned HTTP Header Location. Then search for (read) that Patient using the Location URL value and validate the response.

operation.description: Create a Patient resource and capture the returned HTTP Header Location.
operation.label: CreatePatient

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 201(Created).
assert.label: 01-Response201

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Location is present.
assert.label: 02-ResponseHTTPHeader

operation.description: Read the created Patient using the captured Location URL value.
operation.label: ReadPatientURL

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
assert.label: 01-Response200

assert.description: Confirm that the returned resource type is Patient.
assert.label: 02-ResponseResourceType

test.name: Patient Search Dynamic
test.description: Search for Patient resources using the user defined dynamic variables ${PatientSearchFamilyName} and ${PatientSearchGivenName} and validate response.

operation.description: Search for Patient resources on the destination test system.
operation.label: SearchPatient

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
assert.label: 01-Response200

assert.description: Confirm that the returned format is XML.
assert.label: 02-ResponseFormat

assert.description: Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.
assert.label: 03-ResponseResourceType

assert.description: Confirm that the returned Bundle conforms to the base FHIR specification.
assert.label: 04-ResponseBundle

assert.description: Confirm that the returned Bundle type equals 'searchset'.
assert.label: 05-ResponseBundleType

assert.description: Confirm that the returned Bundle total is greater than or equal to the number of returned entries.
assert.label: 06-ResponseBundleTotal
